meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be tested.
meanings.sent1: Her testabilities were evident in the way she approached challenges.
meanings.sent2: The scientist was impressed by the testabilities of the new equipment.
meanings.sent3: The testabilities of the cake's deliciousness were confirmed by everyone at the party.
meanings.sent4: His testabilities in problem-solving shone brightly during the competition.
meanings.sent5: The testabilities of the theory were put to the ultimate test in the experiment.

meanings.definition: The extent to which something can be tested or proven.
meanings.sent1: The testabilities of the hypothesis were questioned by the research team.
meanings.sent2: The testabilities of the new medicine were confirmed through rigorous trials.
meanings.sent3: The testabilities of the cat's intelligence were put to the test with a challenging puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The testabilities of the company's success were evident in its consistent growth.
meanings.sent5: The testabilities of the concept were explored through various experiments.
